Wamendes: Kemakmuran Itu Bukan Hadiah
06 Nov 2019, 23:01 by Ninding Yulius Permana


Wamendes: Kemakmuran Itu Bukan Hadiah

KBRN, Majalengka : Wakil Menteri Desa, Pembangunan Daerah Tertinggal, dan Transmigrasi, Budi Arie Setiadi melanjutkan agenda kunjungan kerja ke desa-desa, kali ini desa di wilayah Kabupaten Majalengka pada Rabu (6/11/2019).Terdapat tiga desa di Kabupaten Majalengka yang dikunjungi yaitu Desa Cieurih dengan status desa tertinggal, Desa Maja Selatan dengan status desa mandiri dan Desa Pagandon dengan status desa maju.Wamen Budi menilai, Desa Cieurih yang saat ini dikunjungi sudah tidak termasuk desa tertinggal. Sebab, dari segi infrastruktur, akses jalan, dan sinyal telepon seluler sudah tersedia."Kalau kami menilai, desa ini sebetulnya sudah bagus, halamannya sudah rapih, sinyal telepon seluler juga sudah ada, tinggal bagaimana dana desa ini kita gunakan untuk meningkatkan produktifitas ekonomi desa ini" ujarnya.Ia menambahkan, berdasarkan arahan presiden Joko Widodo dan Mendes PDTT Abdul Halim Iskandar, bahwa dana desa harus bermanfaat untuk mendukung peningkatan ekonomi masyarakat. Wamendes PDTT mengingatkan kepada seluruh masyarakat harus lebih aktif berpartisipasi dalam pengawasan penggunaan dana desa. Menurutnys, Selama lima tahun dana desa sudah dikucurkan sebesar Rp 257 Triliun dan pada tahun 2020-2024 Presiden akan terus meningkatkan dana desa."Kemakmuran dan kemajuan itu bukan hadiah. Tapi upaya gotong royong segenap konponen  masyarakat. Saya berharap dana desa dapat menjadi modal pergerakan ekonomi masyarakat desa, dan uangnya terus berputar sehingga masyarakat desa semakin maju dan makmur," pesannya.Ia berharap semuanya dapat bekerjasama, dengan Kades, Camat, Kepala Dinas, Bupati dan semuanya saling bergotong royong untuk kepentingan masyarakat dan bersama-sama bekerja keras untuk memajukan Indonesia.Dalam kunjungan ini, Wamendes PDTT didampingi oleh Wakil Bupati Majalengka, Tarsono D Mardiana dan Direktur Pembangunan Sarana Prasarana Desa, Muklis dan SKPD di lingkungan Kabupaten Majalengka.

Vice Minister of Trade: Prosperity Is Not a Gift
06 Nov 2019, 23:01 by Ninding Yulius Permana


Vice Minister of Trade: Prosperity Is Not a Gift

KBRN, Majalengka: Deputy Minister of Villages, Disadvantaged Regions, and Transmigration, Budi Arie Setiadi continued the agenda of working visits to villages, this time villages in Majalengka Regency on Wednesday (11/06/2019). There were three villages in Majalengka Regency visited were Cieurih Village with underdeveloped village status, South Maja Village with independent village status and Pagandon Village with advanced village status. Budi Budi assesses that Cieurih Village currently visited is not included as underdeveloped village. Because, in terms of infrastructure, road access, and cell phone signals are already available. "If we judge, this village is actually already good, the yard is already neat, cell phone signals are also available, just how do we use these village funds to increase village economic productivity "he said. He added, based on the direction of President Joko Widodo and Mendes PDTT Abdul Halim Iskandar, that village funds must be useful to support the improvement of the community's economy. The Vice Minister of PDTT reminded all communities to be more active in participating in monitoring the use of village funds. According to Nys, for five years the village funds have been disbursed as much as Rp. 257 Trillion and in 2020-2024 the President will continue to increase village funds. "Prosperity and progress are not gifts. But mutual cooperation efforts of all community members. I hope the village funds can become capital for the movement of movement. the economy of the village community, and the money continues to rotate so that the village community is more advanced and prosperous, "he said. He hopes that everyone can work together, with the village head, sub-district head, head of office, regent and all work together to work together for the interests of the community and work hard together to advance Indonesia.In this visit, the Vice Minister of PDTT was accompanied by the Deputy Regent of Majalengka, Tarsono D Mardiana and the Director of Village Infrastructure Development, Muklis and SKPD in the Majalengka Regency.
